result.execSummary:
The defendant Holly F. Wanty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Figure to be provided within 60 days

Supervision fees
AODA assessment and recovery
Random alcohol/drug testing
Comply with Chapter 51 order
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

records.addlTxt:
02:09 pm - Defendant Holly F. Wanty in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend to one count of Issuance of a worthless check a Class A Misdemeanor - 943.24(1) - Granted.  Defendant pleads guilty.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Michilg/Voorhees/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP 1 yr
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
AODA assessment and recovery
Random alcohol/drug testing
Comply with Chapter 51 order
Restitution - TBD - within 60 days of today's date
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given

Defendant Holly F. Wanty in court with attorney John E. Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
4:11
Michlig statement - on stipulation of parties- request court review PC portion  -Court reviews and finds that Probable cause does exists
Information filed- in receipt, waive reading -not guilty plea
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

03:25 pm - Defendant Holly F. Wanty in court with attorney John E. Voorhees.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 4, 2014 at 03:15 pm.

02:02 pm - Defendant Holly F. Wanty in court with attorney John E. Voorhees.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Voorhees requests continuance.  In receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Schiek/Voorhees to bond.  Court sets sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
from DA setting Initial Appearance date and time.

03:15 pm - Defendant Holly F. Wanty not in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bednar states defendant is currently hospitzalized.  DA to notify of next hearing date.  Initial appearance scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
